title: Cardano Offline Developer's Kit
description: How do we increase the adoption of  Cardano's Blockchain  for DeFi Project Development in Internet-challenged regions?

f6_assessments.q0: This seems like a good idea to lower hurdles and widen the net of people who can create Defi projects for Cardano. Is there an issue with the data getting quickly out of date though?
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers a likely to be able to create the contents and load it onto the hardware. It seem like they need to firm up how they are going to market and deliver them.
f6_assessments.q2: Auditing the creation of the hardware should be simple. The team should provide some metrics for success however.  These should be focussed on getting the USB sticks into people hands in a timely manner and then more importantly tracking how many of those people progress to become developers in the Cardano ecosystem. It would be good to have some goals set against which success can the be measured.

f6_assessments.q0:
Yes internet challenged  areas are for sure not getting opportunities  to reap the benefit ; however I think that students needs to be incentivized in accomplishing learning how do you rate student achievement and how to gauge the student effectiveness of learning.  
If you can include autocorrected multiple choice and a grading system . and can upload their scores weekly.
f6_assessments.q1: the main purpose is to have way to validate the student's learning progress. and devise a system by testing the student knowledge.
f6_assessments.q2: You should have a way to offer student to upload their scores this way you can have a relevant audit of your project.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal very effectively address the challenge of onboarding developers with less resources into the world of Plutus development on Cardano, opening the door to more developers coming up with novel defi solutions to be implemented in the Cardano ecosystem. 

Many of these developers themselves would be in a position to help attack local problems with blockchain solutions, and this may very well be these peoples first interaction with technology, and blockchain as a whole, and would have a position impress with the local community from day 1.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the team has several Plutus developers already, and a clear vision for the project, I feel it is likely that the team will deliver as described via the roadmap provided and the funding amount requested.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap looks solid, but more specific KPIs would make it easier to quantitatively measure the success of the proposal for both voters and project catalyst.

solution: **A FREE USB STICK**: An offline developer kit with selected Cardano resources aim at Internet-challenged regions for  new Cardano developers
